section.section: In this section the following terms have the meanings indicated.

"Additional education appropriation" means the difference between a county's education appropriation for the prior fiscal year and the county's local share of the foundation program calculated under § 5-202 of this subtitle.
"Additional education effort" means a county's additional education appropriation divided by the county's wealth, rounded to seven decimal places.
"Full-time equivalent enrollment" has the meaning stated in § 5-202 of this subtitle.

"Guaranteed tax base program per pupil amount" means the lesser of:
20% of the annual per pupil foundation amount calculated under § 5-202 of this subtitle; and
The product of a county's additional education effort and the difference between guaranteed wealth per pupil and local wealth per pupil.
"Guaranteed wealth per pupil" means 80% of the statewide wealth per pupil.
"Local wealth per pupil" means a county's wealth divided by the county's full-time equivalent enrollment.
"Statewide wealth per pupil" means the sum of the wealth of all counties divided by the statewide full-time equivalent enrollment.
"Wealth" has the meaning stated in § 5-202 of this subtitle.

text.section: For fiscal year 2005 and each fiscal year thereafter, the State shall distribute guaranteed tax base grants to county boards as provided in this section.

A county board is eligible to receive a guaranteed tax base grant if the county's:
Additional education effort is greater than zero; and
Local wealth per pupil is less than the guaranteed wealth per pupil.
